en: I missed my stop. How long does it take to reach the next stop?
zh: 我坐过站了，到下一站还要多久？

en: Do you want a ride?
zh: 要载你一程吗？

en: We cannot meet the demands of the hijackers.
zh: 我们无法满足劫机者的要求。

en: Please get in.
zh: 请上车。

en: Could you make it a little shorter for me?
zh: 能帮我改短一点吗？

en: It was the tall man in the long, black coat.
zh: 是那个穿黑色长风衣的高个子。

en: If the boss says you've got to work overtime, then there's no choice but to do so.
zh: 老板要是让你加班，你就只能加了。

en: It is courageous of him to oppose his boss.
zh: 他敢跟老板对着干，真够勇敢的。

en: He was wearing a long black coat that reached almost to his ankles.
zh: 他穿了一件黑色长外套，都快到脚踝了。

en: The long black coat reached almost to his ankles.
zh: 那件黑色长外套几乎快垂到脚踝了。

en: Don't be subservient to your boss.
zh: 别对你老板唯唯诺诺的。

en: Ueno is the station after next.
zh: 上野是下下站。

en: The cherry blossoms at Ueno are at their best now.
zh: 上野的樱花现在开得正漂亮。

en: Something is flashing up ahead.
zh: 前面有什么东西在闪。

en: Please undress from the waist up.
zh: 请把上衣脱了。

en: We have to be respectful to our seniors.
zh: 我们得尊敬前辈。

en: I wear my coat to rags.
zh: 我这件外套穿得都快烂了。

en: Put your coat on, or you'll catch cold.
zh: 把外套穿上，不然会感冒的。

en: Put on a coat. If you don't, you'll catch a cold.
zh: 穿件外套吧，省得感冒了。

en: May I take off my coat?
zh: 我可以把外套脱了吗？

en: Take your coat off, and make yourself at home.
zh: 把外套脱了吧，随便坐。

en: Take your coat off and make yourself at home.
zh: 脱了外套，别客气。

en: He's putting on a coat.
zh: 他正穿外套呢。

en: I put my coat on the table.
zh: 我把外套搁桌子上了。

en: The coat does not fit properly across the shoulders.
zh: 这件大衣肩膀那儿不合身。

en: A coat is an article of clothing.
zh: 外套也是一种衣服。

en: On him the coat did not meet in the front.
zh: 他穿这大衣，前面都扣不上。

en: You'd better wear a sweater under your jacket.
zh: 你最好在夹克里套件毛衣。

en: Your jacket and tie don't go together.
zh: 你的夹克和领带一点都不搭。

en: Hang your coat and hat up on the rack over there.
zh: 把你的外套和帽子挂在那边的架子上。

en: You have done a very good job.
zh: 你干得真不赖。

en: You've done a very good job.
zh: 你做得挺不错的。

en: A good lawyer will always zero in on a key piece of evidence.
zh: 厉害的律师总能抓住关键证据。

en: A good sailor only requires a short time to get his sea legs.
zh: 优秀的水手很快就能适应航行。

en: Excellent putt.
zh: 推球推得漂亮！

en: That was an excellent putt.
zh: 刚才那一杆推得真棒。

en: Do you think it will work?
zh: 你觉得这行得通吗？

en: A good diplomat is a person who practices the technique of letting someone else let the cat out of the bag.
zh: 聪明的外交官就是那种能让别人说漏嘴的人。

en: It's made of fine cotton.
zh: 这是用优质棉做的。

en: Quality goods are worth it in the long run.
zh: 长远来看，买质量好的东西还是值得的。

en: Don't risk insulting your boss.
zh: 别冒险去顶撞老板。

en: It's rude to make fun of your boss in public.
zh: 当众拿老板开涮挺没礼貌的。

en: My supervisor looked at the revised schedule and nodded his agreement.
zh: 上司看了修改后的时间表，点头表示同意。

en: The boss allotted tasks to his men.
zh: 老板给手下分配了任务。

en: The boss directed his men to finish it quickly.
zh: 老板指挥手下赶紧干完。

en: My boss dictated a letter for his secretary to type.
zh: 老板口述了一封信让秘书打出来。

en: My boss turned down his proposal.
zh: 我老板拒绝了他的提议。

en: My boss rejected the budget for the new project.
zh: 我老板没批那个新项目的预算。

en: The boss asked Mr Brown to take charge of the office while she was away.
zh: 老板不在的时候让布朗先生负责办公室的事。

en: My boss made me work last Sunday.
zh: 老板上周日让我加班了。

en: My boss isn't satisfied with my report.
zh: 老板对我的报告不满意。

en: My superior excused me for arriving late.
zh: 上司没计较我迟到的事。

en: My boss grumbled at me about my work.
zh: 老板冲我抱怨我的工作。

en: Our boss turned down our proposal.
zh: 老板拒绝了我们的方案。

en: After the hatchet job my boss did on my proposal, I'm not sure how long I want to keep on working here.
zh: 老板把我方案批得一无是处，我都不知道还能在这儿干多久。

en: My boss didn't excuse me for coming late to the meeting.
zh: 老板没原谅我开会迟到。

en: My boss doesn't think I am equal to the job.
zh: 老板觉得我干不了这活。

en: My boss called me down for making private calls on the office phone.
zh: 老板因为我用办公电话打私人电话把我训了一顿。

en: My boss called me down for frequent absence from work.
zh: 老板因为我经常缺勤把我训了。

en: My boss will not say 'yes'.
zh: 老板肯定不会答应的。

en: My boss assigned the hard job to me.
zh: 老板把苦差事都分给我了。

en: My boss is starting to get edgy.
zh: 老板开始变得有点急躁了。

en: My boss is always finding fault with me.
zh: 老板老是找我茬。

en: My boss detained me more than 30 minutes.
zh: 老板把我留下了半个多小时。

en: I should tell you that my boss, Mr Tanaka, might try to take you drinking.
zh: 我得跟你说一下，我老板田中先生可能会带你去喝酒。

en: The boss'll have my head.
zh: 老板会要了我的命的。

en: The boss will be angry at me.
zh: 老板会生我气的。

en: The boss is going to get mad at me.
zh: 老板要跟我发火了。

en: My boss made me work overtime.
zh: 老板让我加班。

en: I could not but talk back to my boss.
zh: 我忍不住顶了老板几句。

en: I'll get permission from my superior.
zh: 我得先找上司批一下。

en: You should know better than to talk back to your boss.
zh: 你不该顶撞你老板的。

en: My supervisor is making me do this so I'm in no hurry to finish.
zh: 这是我主管硬塞给我做的，所以我也不急着做完。

en: I skipped out on my appointment with my boss.
zh: 我放了老板鸽子。

en: My boss invited me to dinner.
zh: 老板请我吃晚饭。

en: I hope my boss will agree to my realistic plan.
zh: 我希望老板能同意我这个务实的计划。

en: My boss gave me so much work that I couldn't leave the office.
zh: 老板给我派了这么多活，我走都走不了。

en: We had a glimpse of the lake as we flew over it.
zh: 飞过湖面上空的时候，我们瞅见了一眼。

en: The jet made a whining sound as it soared overhead.
zh: 喷气式飞机从头顶飞过，发出尖厉的轰鸣声。

en: I stayed at my uncle's while I was in Tokyo.
zh: 我在东京的时候住在我叔叔家。

en: Allow me to know in advance when you are coming up to Tokyo.
zh: 你来东京之前提前跟我打个招呼。

en: He had not been in Tokyo a month when he got homesick.
zh: 他来东京还不到一个月就想家了。

en: I hoped to have seen you when I went to Tokyo.
zh: 我本想去东京的时候见见你的。

en: Senior executives spend a lot of time training their subordinates.
zh: 高管们花很多时间培训下属。

en: Shanghai is among the largest cities in the world.
zh: 上海是世界上最大的城市之一。

en: The population of Shanghai is as large as that of Tokyo.
zh: 上海的人口和东京差不多。

en: There are many more beautiful ladies in Shanghai than in Tokyo.
zh: 上海的美女比东京多多了。

en: Two passenger trains crashed in Shanghai.
zh: 上海有两列客运火车相撞了。

en: When does the show start?
zh: 演出什么时候开始？

en: The senator charged that I had distorted the data.
zh: 参议员指责我歪曲了数据。

en: Between them, the two largest companies account for a share of more than 50% of the market.
zh: 这两家最大的公司合起来占了超过一半的市场份额。

en: Feel the top and see how warm it is.
zh: 摸摸上面，看热不热。

en: Where's the up-escalator?
zh: 上楼的扶梯在哪儿？

en: The Queen lives in Buckingham Palace.
zh: 女王住在白金汉宫。

en: Evidence that the above example is farfetched can be seen by comparing the total occurrences of component X.
zh: 对比组件 X 的总出现次数，就能看出上面的例子太牵强了。

en: The people upstairs come home late at night.
zh: 楼上的人半夜才回家。

en: I heard a strange sound coming from the room above.
zh: 我听到上面的房间传来奇怪的声音。

en: Please take the sugar pot down from the upper shelf.
zh: 请把糖罐从上面的架子上拿下来。

en: What is shown in the above experiment is that the right hemisphere of the brain is not used at all.
zh: 上面的实验表明，右脑完全没有被用到。

en: The animal in the top left-hand corner is meant to be a dragon.
zh: 左上角那个动物画的是条龙。

en: I'm sorry but it's not my position to make a decision.
zh: 抱歉，这事儿轮不到我做决定。

en: Before we try to move up to the next level, I think we need to focus on keeping what we have.
zh: 在想怎么更上一层楼之前，我觉得咱们还是先稳住现状吧。

en: See the example given above.
zh: 看一下上面的例子。

en: The higher up we went, the colder it became.
zh: 越往上走，天就越冷。

en: The numerical values shown above derive from Hobson's simulation.
zh: 上面这些数值是根据霍布森的模拟算出来的。

en: The higher you climb, the greater the fall.
zh: 爬得越高，摔得越惨。

en: The sound rises and falls.
zh: 声音忽高忽低。

en: The island as seen from above resembles a pear in shape.
zh: 从上面看，这个岛的样子像个梨。

en: A rock fell from above.
zh: 上面掉下来一块石头。

en: Hurdling the wall will make him stronger.
zh: 翻过这道墙会让他变得更强壮。

en: Some people are gifted with the ability to iron out difficulties while others are born trouble makers.
zh: 有些人天生就有解决困难的本事，而有些人天生就是捣蛋鬼。

en: Has the bell rung yet?
zh: 铃响了吗？

en: The bell chimed them to meals.
zh: 铃声响了，叫他们去吃饭。

en: Directly the bell rang, we got up.
zh: 铃一响我们就起床了。

en: As soon as the bell rang, we got up.
zh: 铃响了之后，我们立刻就起床了。

en: He came five minutes after the bell had rung.
zh: 铃响过五分钟后，他才来。

en: He turned out to be a real disappointment after we went through hell and high water to find him.
zh: 咱们费了九牛二虎之力才找到他，结果他真让人失望。

en: The prize went to him.
zh: 奖项归他了。

en: You shall have this album as a prize.
zh: 这张相册就当作奖品送给你了。

en: I hope you will succeed in winning the prize.
zh: 希望你能拿到奖。

en: The elephant was killed by the hunter.
zh: 那头大象被猎人杀了。

en: The elephant is the largest land animal.
zh: 大象是陆地上最大的动物。

en: An elephant has a long nose.
zh: 大象长着长鼻子。

en: Elephants have long trunks.
zh: 大象的鼻子很长。

en: An elephant is a very large animal.
zh: 大象是一种体型庞大的动物。

en: Elephants are in danger of dying out.
zh: 大象正面临灭绝的危险。

en: An elephant is an enormous animal.
zh: 大象是个大家伙。

en: The elephant is bigger than all the other animals.
zh: 大象比其他所有动物都要大。

en: The elephants are the chief attraction at the circus.
zh: 大象是马戏团里最受欢迎的明星。

en: Elephants live in Asia and Africa.
zh: 大象生活在亚洲和非洲。

en: This book says that elephants live to be over 100 years old.
zh: 书上说大象能活一百多岁。

en: The size of the elephant astonished the little boy.
zh: 那个小男孩被大象巨大的体型惊呆了。

en: An elephant is a strong animal.
zh: 大象力气很大。

en: Have you ever seen an elephant fly?
zh: 你见过会飞的大象吗？

en: More detailed information will be supplied on application to the publisher.
zh: 想要更详细的信息可以联系出版商。

en: For particulars, apply to the college.
zh: 详情请咨询学院。

en: Apply to the office for further details.
zh: 想要了解更多细节请去办公室问问。

en: I didn't go into details.
zh: 我没细说。

en: For further details, call Gisèle.
zh: 想要更多细节的话，给吉赛尔打电话。

en: The investigation revealed him to be a spy.
zh: 调查发现他竟然是个间谍。

en: There isn't time to explain in detail.
zh: 没时间细说了。

en: Let me know the details.
zh: 把详细情况告诉我。

en: A thorough investigation is now in progress.
zh: 目前正在进行彻底调查。

en: A detailed report will be sent you by next mail.
zh: 详细报告下次会邮寄给你。

en: Don't rush into the situation until you have all the details; hold your horses until you know where you are going.
zh: 没搞清楚状况前别急着行动，先稳住，弄明白方向再说。

en: The confirmation hearings turned into a free-for-all.
zh: 确认听证会最后演变成了大混战。

en: I move that the witness be summoned on Monday.
zh: 我提议周一传唤证人。

en: The concealment of facts by a witness is a criminal offense.
zh: 证人隐瞒事实是违法行为。

en: Loan on deeds needed the joint surety.
zh: 契约抵押贷款需要共同担保人。

en: In the absence of definite evidence, he was acquitted.
zh: 因为没有确凿的证据，他被无罪释放了。

en: In the absence of firm evidence the prisoner was set free.
zh: 因为缺乏确凿的证据，囚犯被释放了。

en: When he was faced with the evidence, he had to admit that he was guilty.
zh: 在证据面前，他不得不承认自己有罪。

en: There is not even a semblance of proof.
zh: 连一点证据的影子都没有。

en: The evidence is clear.
zh: 证据很清楚。

en: The evidence is laid out before us. Considering that, together with the fact that he has no alibi, there's no question that he's the guilty one.
zh: 证据都摆在眼前了。再加上他没有不在场证明，肯定是他干的，没跑了。

en: The evidence was against me.
zh: 证据对我非常不利。

en: The evidence convinced us of his innocence.
zh: 证据让我们相信他是清白的。

en: You can't accuse him of stealing unless you have proof.
zh: 除非你有证据，不然你不能指责他偷东西。

en: He recalled that a collision had been avoided by sheer luck.
zh: 他想起那次没撞上纯粹是运气好。

en: As soon as he heard the crash, he rushed out of the house.
zh: 他一听到撞击声就冲出了屋子。

en: I'll never forget the sound the crash made.
zh: 我永远忘不了那声巨响。

en: In preparation for painting a portrait, my friend takes many photographs in order to study the subject closely.
zh: 我朋友在画肖像画之前会拍很多照片，好仔细观察对象。

en: Did anybody recommend us to you?
zh: 是有人向你推荐我们的吗？

en: What's the name of the person who recommended us to you?
zh: 推荐我们给你的那个人叫什么名字？

en: Let me introduce myself.
zh: 我自我介绍一下。

en: Please let me introduce myself.
zh: 请允许我自我介绍一下。

en: Thank you for your referral.
zh: 谢谢你的推荐。

en: I'm used to being laughed at.
zh: 我习惯被别人笑话了。

en: Don't make me laugh!
zh: 别逗我笑！

en: You amuse me.
zh: 你真逗。

en: I cannot help laughing.
zh: 我忍不住想笑。

en: Laugh and be fat.
zh: 心宽体胖。

en: I want to die laughing.
zh: 我快笑死了。

en: Please don't laugh! Try it yourself!
zh: 别笑！你自己试试！

en: Fortune comes in by a merry gate.
zh: 笑口常开，好运自然来。

en: Laughter is a human instinct, and when it comes to instinct, cultural barriers don't exist.
zh: 笑是人的本能，既然是本能，就没有文化隔阂。

en: It is no laughing matter.
zh: 这可不是闹着玩的。

en: It was no laughing matter.
zh: 那可不是开玩笑的事。

en: Laughter is the best medicine.
zh: 笑是良药。

en: Is laughter a quality of man only?
zh: 只有人类才会笑吗？

en: A kiss will be given to the person who wants to laugh.
zh: 谁想笑就亲谁一下。

en: I was laughing so hard I nearly dislocated my jaw.
zh: 我笑得下巴都快掉下来了。

en: That goes beyond a joke.
zh: 这玩笑开得有点过分了。

en: It's no laughing matter.
zh: 这事儿一点也不好笑。

en: This isn't funny.
zh: 这不好笑。

en: A national campaign for energy saving is underway.
zh: 全国性的节能运动正在开展中。

en: Is this symptom getting better or worse?
zh: 这个症状是好转了还是加重了？

en: Your condition isn't serious.
zh: 你的病情不严重。

en: You should consult a doctor if the symptoms get worse.
zh: 如果症状加重，你应该去看医生。

en: Make sure you go to a doctor if you get worse.
zh: 如果情况恶化，一定要去看医生。

en: Terumi gave me a thin smile again.
zh: 照美又对我淡淡地笑了笑。

en: Please give us three references.
zh: 请给我们提供三个推荐人。

en: Stay calm, and do your best.
zh: 保持冷静，尽力而为。

en: Stay calm and do your best.
zh: 冷静点，好好表现。

en: I want to take things one step at a time without getting flustered. I want to live in the moment.
zh: 我想一步一个脚印，不慌不忙。我想活在当下。

en: Jealousy is an enemy to friendship.
zh: 嫉妒是友谊的大敌。

en: A mother's heart is always with her children.
zh: 当妈的心总是牵挂着孩子。

en: It is broiling hot.
zh: 天气热得要命。

en: It's baking hot.
zh: 天热得像火烤一样。

en: Won't you have some bread hot from the oven?
zh: 要不要来点刚出炉的热面包？

en: Please have some copies made.
zh: 请去复印几份。

en: I don't like grilled fish, let alone raw fish.
zh: 我不喜欢烤鱼，更别说生鱼片了。

en: A freshly baked cake doesn't cut easily.
zh: 刚烤出来的蛋糕不好切。

en: The beaches in Shonan are very crowded on Sunday.
zh: 湘南的海滩周日人特别多。

en: Tell me what you did in Shounan.
zh: 跟我说说你在湘南都干了什么。

en: The fire brigade was on the scene within five minutes of receiving the call.
zh: 接到电话后五分钟内，消防队就赶到了现场。

en: The fire station is next to the police station.
zh: 消防站在警察局隔壁。

en: Please call the fire department.
zh: 请给消防队打电话。

en: Fire engines have priority over other vehicles.
zh: 消防车比其他车辆有优先通行权。

en: Before the fire engine arrived, the whole house was burnt down.
zh: 消防车赶到之前，整座房子都已经烧没了。

en: The house was ablaze when the fire engine arrived.
zh: 消防车赶到时，那房子正烧得厉害。

en: The fireman rushed into the burning house.
zh: 消防员冲进了着火的房子。

en: The fire fighters put out the fire.
zh: 消防员把火扑灭了。

en: The fireman soon put the fire out.
zh: 消防员很快就把火灭了。

en: The firemen had the fire out in no time.
zh: 消防员一下子就把火扑灭了。

en: The firemen rushed into the burning house.
zh: 消防员们冲进了着火的房子。

en: The firefighters put out the fire on the spot.
zh: 消防员当场就把火灭了。

en: The fireman could not extinguish the flames.
zh: 消防员没法把火扑灭。

en: The firemen battered down the door.
zh: 消防员把门撞开了。

en: The firemen quickly extinguished the blaze.
zh: 消防员很快就扑灭了大火。

en: The firemen soon put out the fire.
zh: 消防员很快就把火扑灭了。

en: The area was cordoned off while fire fighters tried to keep the blaze under control.
zh: 消防员在努力控制火势的时候，那片区域被封锁了。

en: The firemen protect us from fires.

zh: 谁也说不准以后会发生什么。

en: I expect a subway station will be here in the future.
zh: 我觉得以后这儿会建个地铁站。

en: What would he like to be in the future?
zh: 他以后想做什么？

en: What are you going to be in the future?
zh: 你以后打算干什么？

en: In the future we may need to take another look at the way decisions such as this are actually implemented.
zh: 以后咱们可能得重新审视一下这种决策是怎么落实的。

en: When, one day, computers undertake to translate literary works, it will be the end of literature as we know it.
zh: 等哪天电脑都能翻译文学作品了，咱们所知道的那种文学也就玩完了。

en: The officer inspired his men to be brave.
zh: 那个军官激励他的士兵要勇敢。

en: Officers will henceforth wear ties at dinner.
zh: 军官们以后吃晚饭都得打领带。

en: The general cut a distinguished figure in his dress uniform.
zh: 将军穿上礼服看起来威风凛凛。

en: The general said to the brave man, "You deserve a medal."
zh: 将军对那个勇士说：“你该得枚勋章。”

en: The general concentrated the soldiers in Paris.
zh: 将军把兵力都集中到了巴黎。

en: The general ordered the massacre of all war prisoners.
zh: 将军下令屠杀所有的战俘。

en: The general participated in the plot with his men.
zh: 将军和部下一起参与了这个阴谋。

en: The general commanded them to move on.
zh: 将军命令他们继续前进。

en: The general commanded him to report to headquarters.
zh: 将军命令他去总部报到。

en: The general took the bull by the horns and saved his army from disaster.
zh: 将军当机立断，把他的军队从灾难中救了出来。

en: The general shook hands with us.
zh: 将军和我们握了手。

en: The general commanded that the city be attacked.
zh: 将军下令攻城。

en: The general had 20/20 hindsight about the defeat, but no foresight at all.
zh: 将军对失败全是事后诸葛亮，事前一点远见都没有。

en: The general never lost his presence of mind in the face of the large force of the enemy.
zh: 面对强大的敌军，将军始终镇定自若。

en: The general's massive presence awes everyone.
zh: 将军那股强大的气场把所有人都镇住了。

en: He who would the daughter win, with the mother must begin.
zh: 想要搞定女儿，得先搞定丈母娘。

en: I am going to apply for a scholarship.
zh: 我准备申请奖学金。

en: The scholarship enabled her to study abroad.
zh: 这笔奖学金让她能去国外留学。

en: The scholarship enable her to go to college.
zh: 奖学金让她上得起大学。

en: The scholarship enabled her to go to university.
zh: 奖学金让她上了大学。

en: I got a grant for my tuition.
zh: 我拿到了一笔学费补助。

en: The scholarship made it possible for him to continue his education.
zh: 奖学金让他能继续念书。

en: The Commerce Department reports retail sales rose seven-tenths of 1 percent last month mainly thanks to strong auto sales.
zh: 商务部报告说，上个月零售额增长了0.7%，主要是靠汽车销售拉动的。

en: Commercial Code can be called an enterprise method.
zh: 商法可以被看作是一种企业经营的准则。

en: It often happens that goods sell all the better for their high price.
zh: 经常有这种事，东西越贵反而越好卖。

en: The goods were transported by ship.
zh: 货是走海运发的。

en: All the goods for sale are set out on the tables.
zh: 卖的东西全都摆在桌子上了。

en: If you wish, you may pick them up, or we would be glad to send them back to you.
zh: 如果你想，可以自己来取，或者我们给你寄回去也行。

en: Don't touch the goods.
zh: 别碰这些货。

en: Please use our toll-free number for calls regarding merchandise.
zh: 关于商品的问题，请打我们的免费服务电话。

en: I always have to wear a tie because of my job.
zh: 因为工作的关系，我总得打领带。

en: Two of a trade seldom agree.
zh: 同行是冤家。

en: After business came to a halt, many bathhouses added new facilities, such as saunas and exercise equipment, in an effort to attract customers.
zh: 生意冷清之后，很多澡堂为了揽客，都加了桑拿和健身器材什么的。

en: Merchants complain about the depression.
zh: 商家们都在抱怨生意不景气。

en: Business was a little slow last month.
zh: 上个月生意有点淡。

en: The business is in the red.
zh: 公司现在在亏损。

en: It's all up with my business.
zh: 我的生意算是彻底完蛋了。

en: Business is declining.
zh: 生意越来越不景气了。

en: Business is quite slow.
zh: 生意挺冷清的。

en: How's business?
zh: 生意怎么样？

en: Your business is flourishing, I hear.
zh: 听说你生意做得红红火火的。

en: Business is looking up.
zh: 生意好起来了。

en: I don't know the ABC of business.
zh: 我对做生意一窍不通。

en: Efficiency is the dominant idea in business.
zh: 做生意最要紧的就是效率。

en: Such a business failure would sink any company.
zh: 这种生意上的失败能让任何公司垮台。

en: Trade is getting depressed.
zh: 贸易越来越萧条了。

en: The business is slow.
zh: 生意很冷清。

en: Shops are quiet on weekdays.
zh: 工作日商店里没什么人。

en: The shop did not want him.
zh: 那家店不想要他。

en: The shops were bad, but the factory was worse.
zh: 商店的情况已经够糟了，工厂更糟糕。

en: The first session of the trade negotiations is at ten o'clock tomorrow morning.
zh: 贸易谈判的第一场在明天上午十点。

en: Shall we shoot the breeze for a while before talking business?
zh: 谈正事儿之前，我们要不要先闲聊一会儿？

en: The dealer took advantage of her ignorance and bought the picture very cheap.
zh: 商人趁她不懂行，低价把画买走了。

en: A merchant is a person who buys and sells goods.
zh: 商人就是买卖商品的人。

en: The merchant sent the politician a bribe.
zh: 那个商人给那个政客送了贿赂。

en: The merchant bribed the politician.
zh: 商人贿赂了那个政客。

en: Trade companies aim at a new market in Asia.
zh: 贸易公司瞄准了亚洲的新市场。

en: In the case of commercial airplanes, private companies compete to sell their product.
zh: 在商用飞机领域，私企之间为了推销产品竞争很激烈。

en: Commerce led to the development of cities.
zh: 商业带动了城市的发展。

en: The soul of commerce is upright dealing.
zh: 商业的灵魂在于公平交易。

en: Commercial television is an effective medium for advertising.
zh: 商业电视是广告的有效媒介。

en: Treat your servant more kindly.
zh: 对你的仆人好一点。

en: Don't hesitate to tell me if there is anything you would like to eat.
zh: 想吃什么尽管跟我说，别犹豫。

en: The servant swept the floor.
zh: 仆人扫了地。

en: The servant gradually adjusted to his new surroundings.
zh: 仆人渐渐适应了新环境。

en: We're confident of our victory.
zh: 我们对获胜很有信心。

en: We fought hard for victory.
zh: 我们为了胜利拼得很凶。

en: The victory made him a hero.
zh: 胜利让他成了英雄。

en: Victory is unlikely but not impossible.
zh: 赢的可能性不大，但也不是没戏。

en: The day is ours without doubt.
zh: 毫无疑问，今天属于我们。

en: The victory is ours.
zh: 胜利是属于我们的。

en: The victory made us more excited.
zh: 胜利让我们更兴奋了。

en: It is important for us to learn to handle defeats as well as triumphs properly.
zh: 学会正确对待输赢对我们来说很重要。

en: The report of victory turned out to be a little premature.
zh: 胜利的消息报得似乎早了一点。

en: Everyone got excited by the news of the victory.
zh: 大家都为获胜的消息感到兴奋。

en: On hearing of the victory, the whole nation shouted for joy.
zh: 一听到胜利的消息，全国上下欢呼雀跃。

en: All hope of winning the game vanished.
zh: 赢球的所有希望都破灭了。

en: Her efforts were crowned with victory.
zh: 她的努力最终换来了胜利。

en: The match ended in a draw.
zh: 比赛以平局结束。

en: It doesn't matter whether you win or not.
zh: 赢不赢没关系。

en: The chances are even.
zh: 机会是一半一半。

en: Don't enter at the kitchen door.
zh: 别从厨房门进去。

en: Don't try to duck out early. Where's your sense of responsibility?
zh: 别想早退开溜，你的责任感呢？

en: Don't let your imagination run wild.
zh: 别在那儿瞎想了。

en: Have it your way.
zh: 随你便。

en: It is good to be a winner.
zh: 当赢家的感觉真好。

en: Katsuko leads her class in English.
zh: 胜子的英语在班里领先。

en: Masaru doesn't care for this color.
zh: 胜不喜欢这个颜色。

en: Masaru can't finish the work in an hour, can he?
zh: 胜一个小时干不完这活儿，对吧？

en: Whether you win or lose, you should do your best in the match.
zh: 不管输赢，比赛中都要全力以赴。

en: Whether we win or lose, we must play fairly.
zh: 不管输赢，我们都要公平竞争。
